item.title: Brett Bobley on "Examples of active participation of archives/archivists in DH projects?"
item.dc:creator: Brett Bobley
item.description:
Hi -- in the Office of Digital Humanities, we've funded many projects that involve archives and archivists. Here's a list of 58 of them:

https://securegrants.neh.gov/publicquery/main.aspx?q=1&a=0&n=0&o=0&k=1&kv=archive+archives+archivist+archivists&kj=or&f=0&s=0&p=0&d=1&dv=12&y=0&prd=0&cov=0&prz=0&pg=0&ob=year&or=DESC

Brett

item.title: Mark Tebeau on "Examples of active participation of archives/archivists in DH projects?"
item.dc:creator: Mark Tebeau
item.description: The Center for Public History + Digital Humanities has an archivist/librarian as our technology director and lead. In particular, he takes the lead in developing, imagining, and implementing the technology for our projects. See, for example, http://clevelandhistorical.org/.

item.title: kate.theimer@gmail.com on "Examples of active participation of archives/archivists in DH projects?"
item.dc:creator: kate.theimer@gmail.com
item.description:
Hello all,

I'm exploring the roles, or potential roles, of archivists in the digital humanities, and so am looking for examples of active participation or collaboration of archivists in digital humanities projects. Does anyone have any suggestions?

Many thanks,

Kate

Kate Theimer
http://www.archivesnext.com
